igt.tag-types: L B B B M M M M B B B B B B G T

tier.item: b. [Paula]NOM hat (von der Ärztin) Blut abgenommen bekommen.
Adopting the general ideas laid out in Dowty 1991, I propose that AFFECTEE is a thematic relation which
has some prototypical AGENT entailments, and some prototypical PATIENT entailments. AFFECTEES are in-
variably sentient or conscious (proto-AGENT property), and they are invariably causally affected (proto-
PATIENT property).
Paula has by the doctor blood withdrawn got
`The doctor withdrew some of Paula's blood.'
b. [Paula]NOM hat (von der Ärztin) Blut abgenommen bekommen.
Adopting the general ideas laid out in Dowty 1991, I propose that AFFECTEE is a thematic relation which
has some prototypical AGENT entailments, and some prototypical PATIENT entailments. AFFECTEES are in-
variably sentient or conscious (proto-AGENT property), and they are invariably causally affected (proto-
PATIENT property).
Paula has by the doctor blood withdrawn got
`The doctor withdrew some of Paula's blood.'
[Paula]NOM hat (von der Ärztin) Blut abgenommen bekommen.
Adopting the general ideas laid out in Dowty 1991, I propose that AFFECTEE is a thematic relation which
has some prototypical AGENT entailments, and some prototypical PATIENT entailments. AFFECTEES are in-
variably sentient or conscious (proto-AGENT property), and they are invariably causally affected (proto-
PATIENT property).
Paula has by the doctor blood withdrawn got
The doctor withdrew some of Paula's blood.

tier.item: ???Hòulái, t y s-le mqn.
Note that extra arguments in English do not occur in postverbal position as frequently as, for instance, in
German. They are restricted to certain configurations with directional complements that encode bodily
action. Extra subjects are more widespread in English (see section 3.1).
afterwards he also die-PRF mother
`Then his mother died on him.'
???Hòulái, t y s-le mqn.
Note that extra arguments in English do not occur in postverbal position as frequently as, for instance, in
German. They are restricted to certain configurations with directional complements that encode bodily
action. Extra subjects are more widespread in English (see section 3.1).
afterwards he also die-PRF mother
`Then his mother died on him.'
Hòulái, t y s-le mqn.

German. They are restricted to certain configurations with directional complements that encode bodily
action. Extra subjects are more widespread in English (see section 3.1).

tier.item: (44) Olive Oyl komponiert ihrem Baby ein Lied zum Vorsingen

bei Omas Geburtstag.
at grandmother's birthday

mother's birthday.'
